p: Santos-Gomes and Fernandes-Ferreira [ 26] analyzed the essential oil from Portuguese S. officinalis sampled in different months of the year. From December to April, about 20% of oxygenated monoterpenes decreased, while 10% of monoterpene hydrocarbons increased. From February to April, the content of sesquiterpene hydrocarbons increased decreasing thereafter in July. Oxygenated sesquiterpenes increased in July, decreasing thereafter.
